moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nc3 Nc6 3. f4 exf4 4. Nf3 g5: All the games start here. White has sacrificed a Knight to expose Black's King.
moves.8. d4: I open more lines and now threaten to bring my QB into the attack as well.
moves.8... d5: Black defends the KNP and opens a line for his B to participate in the defense.
moves.9. Bxf4: I follow up by developing the B with a capture.
moves.9... Qf6: Black immediately counters by threatening the B.
moves.10... Bd6: Black attacks it again, but leaves himself open...
moves.12... Nxe5: Black brings his Knight to the center.
moves.13. Qxd5+: My most powerful piece joins the attack. The Black Knight is a goner.
moves.13... Qe6 14. Qxe5 Qxe5+: A mistake. Down in material, Black's strategy should be to keep the Q's on the board and seek complications.
moves.16... Rg7 17. Bxg7 Kxg7 18. O-O-O: Now it's a matter of mopping up.
moves.22... Kg8 23. Rfd1: Black resigns, as he has no way to avoid having his Rook be exchanged off.
